Is there any difference between this and Kerpallo 1.0?

Is there any difference between this and Kerpallo 1.0?

Kerpollo included a CSM and Lunar Lander that were both very well made and could be used in two different configurations for flight.

Too bad the guy who made it took it all off the site, along with a load of other cool parts he made after he got mad at the community.
The download wont load... it just opens a new tab... im using Chrome BTW
For the ninth time, here\'s a mirror: http://www./?e8x2lzsi9a5kbrp
I feel that this is more a model than a functional spacecraft. The engines are really weak and the fuel tanks don\'t hold much fuel. I don\'t know maybe you need to revise tech specs again?

I feel that this is more a model than a functional spacecraft. The engines are really weak and the fuel tanks don\'t hold much fuel. I don\'t know maybe you need to revise tech specs again?

I agree, i was able to go to Wikipedia and find thrust, fuel and burn rates for each stage... it took about 20 min to get the engines to accurate power...
Well, the Kerbal Scale is much, much smaller than actual scale. I\'m not sure how overpowered it\'d be if you did the .cfg edits to get it performing like the real thing.

Well, the Kerbal Scale is much, much smaller than actual scale. I\'m not sure how overpowered it\'d be if you did the .cfg edits to get it performing like the real thing.

I\'ve modified both thrust, weight and burn time myself after what I could find on Wikipedia and various other websites. Drag was trickier though, but I got the acceleration in atmosphere roughly correct from looking at launch data, and it\'s definitely very overpowered.

Kerpollo included a CSM and Lunar Lander that were both very well made and could be used in two different configurations for flight.

Too bad the guy who made it took it all off the site, along with a load of other cool parts he made after he got mad at the community.

I\'m... pretty sure I still have them, somewhere...
